target_name: By 2030, end preventable deaths of newborns and children under 5 years of age, with all countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000 live births and under-5 mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births
computation_definitions:
National data (Type1)
This is the national produced statistics in the ROK that best corresponds to the definition of UN SDGs indicators.
Download the national metadata file for more information.
indicator_definition: Number of children dying before reaching the age of 5 years per 100,000 live births
computation_calculations: Death reports filed with city, district, and municipal offices (complemented with fetal and baby death reports from crematories).
un_custodian_agency: UNICEF, UN IGME(Inter-agency Group for child Mortality Estimation)
source_periodicity_1:
- Monthly population trends (birth, death, marriage, divorce): End of month (in two months after the reference month)
- Annual births: (Provisional) end February in the following year, (confirmed) end August in the following year
- Annual deaths: (Provisional) end February in the following year, (confirmed) end September in the following year (as part of the Cause of Death Statistics)
- Annual marriages and divorces: End March in the following year
title: Untitled
